programme.desc: The celebratory launch of a new luxury resort is cut short when a woman is found electrocuted in her hotel bathtub - with the door locked from the inside. It looks like a simple case of suicide, but with Jack Mooney no longer around to confirm Commissioner Selwyns suspicions, DI Neville Parker is temporarily flown over from Manchester to close the case. However, he soon realises that island life is not for him, so when evidence of suspicious activity turns up, he is dismayed to realise he will have to extend his stay and investigate the case as murder.

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: An arrogant little frogman needs the help of Prince Ivandoe to lift his curse and become the big, beautiful bullfrog he once was. Due to a technical error, Prince Ivandoe’s arms have been magically replaced by slimy froggy ones. So he has no choice but to help lift the curse in order to restore his princely arms. The Frogman’s hopeless attempts to find a True Love’s kiss end in failure. So Ivandoe and Bert convince him that his only hope is to earn the forgiveness of The Batwitch - his ex-girlfriend - who was responsible for cursing him in the first place.

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe

Whilst narrowly managing to avoid a royal wedding, both Ivandoe And Bert end up in the Pit of Ow instead…which, all things considered, is actually preferable.

Specs relishes his new role as hero of the day, but his best friend Skinny smells a rat. As does Lamput, who is patently NOT captured. programme.title: Lamput

The course of true love never runs smooth; nor does the course of a moronic mixup between two annoying nerds. A wigless Skinny "crashes" Specs big fancy date (which, you know, Skinny was invited to) and Specs is very rude indeed about it. Now theyve both got broken hearts. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. He tries to disarm it, unfortunately, his attempt only accelerates its countdown.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is in a trance – barks like a dog and starts to dance.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean builds a car washing machine that attracts all manner of customers.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: At a funfair, Mr Bean wins a balloon for Teddy and ties it to him while he plays on the hook a duck. But he’s so engrossed he doesn’t notice his companion floating away! Soon Mr Bean is chasing Teddy as he glides and snags on various fairground rides. Will Mr Bean rescue Teddy before he floats away forever?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput likes nothing more than a pleasant evening watching the night sky for UFOs. The peaceful night is ruined, of course, by those pesky Docs. Which is a shame, because its the one night where a UFO actually appears. Of the aliens who emerge from the strange craft, one bears a striking resemblance to Skinny - and naturally theres a bit of a mixup. The alien gets to live life as a Doc at the Lab. Hes pretty good at it, too. Skinny has to make his way as the pilot of a spaceship. Hes pretty bad at it too. In the end, the foreign food is the last straw, and both parties agree to resume their old lives. Lamput goes back to watching the skies.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput’s been caught! The Docs don’t have much to do now but to give tours to visiting students. Until one of these students, Tuzki specifically, gets lost. Will Tuzki find his way back to class? Not unless Lamput has something to do with it.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: While trying to escape from the Docs at a small sea side town, Lamput meets a lonely sea monster. Lamput attempts to help the sea monster makes friends but all his plans backfires. Now the locals are enraged, and the docs take the opportunity to stir up an angry mob to take down the creature and catch Lamput in the process! Not unless Lamput’s new friend has anything to say about it.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by Petunia’s Grandpa Oink to upgrade his farm. They take things too far, and Grandpa Oink misses some of the things he loves most about farming.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Marvin the Martian hires The Looney Builders to build an outer space ball court on Mars. Bugs is a big fan of the sport, and soon becomes a ball and build “hog.”

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Buff tries to show Batwing how great it is to volunteer to help Gothams needy, but the Legion of Zoom get in the way.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: When a black cat crosses Krypto’s path, he’s determined to catch it before Halloween night is through.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: Krypto embarks on a high-flying chase that creates major mayhem for a bus driver on his way to school.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred is excited to visit The Vault - a high security prison from which no convict has ever escaped. But when the ghost of Stealing Stan (JOHN DiMAGGIO), an inmate who always claimed to be innocent, terrorizes the prison, Fred has to solve the mystery and rethink his stance on criminal justice!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred switches places with Jeff, the tour guide at a history museum, to give him a chance to lead the Gang in solving a mystery.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Miss Wince takes Mrs. Wicket off on holiday in her brand-new, swanky caravan; and Bean is left behind, so he decides to build his own caravan

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean has to retrieve a football from a haunted house … and get back out alive.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally creates an amazing new perfume; but who likes it more? Mrs. Wicket or Scrapper?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is on his way to the seaside when the mini runs out of petrol.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Scrapper gives Bean fleas and Bean is forced to call in the pest control person. His flat will take 24 hours to fumigate.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is determined to make the best cup of java, ever. Oh, and to get rich brewing it.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: At a funfair, Mr Bean wins a balloon for Teddy and ties it to him while he plays on the hook a duck. But he’s so engrossed he doesn’t notice his companion floating away! Soon Mr Bean is chasing Teddy as he glides and snags on various fairground rides. Will Mr Bean rescue Teddy before he floats away forever?

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Kazoom Kids must choose their hero name as they take on Cerealiak with the help of Mighty Moo.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang travels back to Ancient Greece where they play roles in a Greek Mystery, involving a mythological spider woman and a royal wedding.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy is surprised to see his old childhood first crush has become a Goth. Embarrassed that he hasn’t changed at all, Shaggy attends a Goth party with the gang, allowing himself to become initiated into the Goth culture, much to Scooby’s concern - especially when the gang discovers there’s a ferocious plant monster roaming the corridors of the abandoned hospital the Goth’s call home.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: You never can tell when inspiration’s gonna strike. Specs and Skinny are having a nice evening at the theatre, enjoying a magic show, when the perfect Lamput-catching strategy falls right in their lap! “The perfect strategy” is a magic necklace of invisibility. “Falling in their lap” is stealing it from the magician’s dressing room. Specs and Skinny waste no time tracking Lamput down and ruining a perfectly good picnic. As usual the Docs snatch defeat from the jaws of victory when Lamput gets a hold of the necklace. Now the orange blob can morph AND go invisible. No fair!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The animated antics of the hapless bumbler Mr Bean. Mr Bean finally has a showdown with the mysterious Reliant Robin. Who will be the victor?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has got everything ready for Irma’s birthday; card cake candles but he just needs to get her some flowers. But nothing goes to plan as Mr Bean inadvertently causes a car crash involving a bride on her wedding day. There’s no time to lose as Mr Bean promises he’ll get the bride to the church on time. Irma is not a happy lady as Mr Bean is distracted by the task in hand.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Beans landlady orders him to get rid of a mole making a mess of her exquisitely manicured croquet lawn.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The cupboards of the log cabin are hopelessly empty and Grizzys belly is rumbling. Through his binoculars, he observes the overexcited Lemmings slipping all sorts of small metal objects into the slot of a Yummy vending machine!?! The bear joins them on the pontoon. If only they could find some coins to make the machine work. Maybe the solution is to find the booty indicated on the treasure map they unearthed on the beach?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: After accidentally breaking his favorite sofa, Grizzy spots a cozy fishing cabin on a neighboring island. He requisitions the Lemmings canoe to get there but discovers that the new cabin is dilapidated and lacking all comfort. The poor bear had been deluded by a poster. However, a fabulous yacht is moored nearby. It catches both his attention and that of the Lemmings, who have just disembarked on the island!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun taking potshots at sand statues depicting Grizzy. Outraged, he catapults them far into the distance. Grizzy takes advantage of their absence to erect a monumental sculpture of himself. But just as he takes a selfie in front of the sculpture, Grizzy realizes that the Lemmings have laid hands on… a pirate cannon!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: After being hit over the head, the Lemmings become hypnotized by a fitness poster and take themselves for sports coaches. They are determined to forcefully train Grizzy, who would much rather lounge around than do push-ups and squats.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Nothing seems to be biting Grizzys fishing rod and the bear is in despair. Suddenly he spots a fabulous swordfish swimming in the lagoon.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover that several drops of Tabasco sauce poured into a rock fault releases powerful sprays of steam that propel them high into the sky on a pot lid.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have decided to organize a race with two sand yachts they found on the beach. The only thing missing, is a worthy adversary. They put Grizzy, who was taking a nap, on one of the yachts without waking him up. And the race is off. Grizzy wakes up in shock onboard his sand yacht.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird struggles to stop Poison Ivys diabolical schemes because he wants to be in the spotlight. But when he needs to use the bat-o-flage and become invisible, he’ll have to learn that doing good is its own reward.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi enters the world of The Wizard of Oz, where she meets familiar vehicle friends and goes on an amazing quest to see the wizard himself!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi enters the world of The Wizard of Oz, where she meets familiar vehicle friends and goes on an amazing quest to see the wizard himself!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: With Bibi in need of repairs, Batgirl takes Bam out for a spin to stop Mr. Freezes latest icy crime spree.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build a science museum in the desert where Wile E. Coyote becomes distracted by the Road Runner.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Mayor Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a water wheel in the forest where Porky worries about a mythical creature named “Big Feet.”

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build Tibs Squirrel a closet in his tree, but it won’t fit all of Tibs’ stuff and he doesn’t want to get rid of anything.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When The Looney Builders enter a sandcastle building contest, Tweety sees the competition and loses confidence in his idea.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are hired by Dutch to find his missing cursed ruby that causes him to have bad luck when its missing. They help him find Roxie, the burglar, but find out that shes also being cursed by the ruby. The detectives help them fix the curse, share the ruby, and find a connection between the dogs.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom eats some canned cheese that has gone bad and hallucinates. He then gets all sorts of visitors from the Tom and Jerry worlds. Tom must become a better cat to end the nightmare.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Fed up with Toms cat hair, Rick buys the "Suck-Up," a next level Roomba-like cleaner. The Suck-Up patrols the house and cleans nonstop. At first, Tom enjoys the little modern mechanical marvel using it to clean Jerry out of house and home! But when the self-programming machine turns on them both and takes over the house -- Tom and Jerry team up to defeat it.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The storm of the century is brewing - at least according to Tuffy and Jerry who are giving a little pay back to Tom for tormenting them earlier.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its picture day! Spike and Tom end up covered in mud and in the Laundro-mutt grooming van. A fight leads to a runaway van and a bath they both wanted to avoid. Tuffy and Jerry are determined to be included in this years picture.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While checking out a rogue planet, Ella, Slippy and Madhu crash onto its surface. When the heat from underground causes the planets icy crust to burst open, they all tumble down into the darkness and become separated.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella feels terrible when she accidentally ruins some of her mother’s old photographs. She convinces her family to recreate the scenes in the old pictures into new ones! But things don’t go quite as planned -- a lot has changed in space over the years.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and the gang are going camping! But as they approach their camp site, Maggie alerts them that a giant solar flare is heading their way. They must turn off all their electronics until the storm subsides.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is very impressed by Angelie, her mom’s new field assistant. She especially likes the incredible tricks she does on her surfboard!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and her friends play a star-riddle game that is a tradition in Slippy’s family. In order to beat Slippy’s cousins, they need to find some super-giant stars!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty tries out his new snorkeling equipment, but Portly mistakes him as the River Monster. An alarmed Hedge exaggerates the story, and Toad tries to catch the monster on camera as all the Riverbankers watch in anticipation.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: The weasels steal Ratty’s rowing boat but soon find themselves in trouble on a fast flowing river.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Mole struggles to get everyone to embrace his newfound love for forest bathing, he tries to be more like Toad. But the newly confident Mole soon clashes with Toads forceful personality. Can either learn something from the other?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Mole is having a clear-out and gives Toad Mr. Tiddles, his old teddy bear. Once its gone, he has second thoughts. But the weasels kidnap Mr. Tiddles, and Mole and Toad have to mount a daring rescue mission to get dear Mr. Tiddles back.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Adder sets one riverbanker against the other in order to seize all of Mole’s toffee apple pie but they soon realise she is up to one of her tricks again.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean ends up on stage at the opera house...in a dress!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When one of the toy cars of his racing track set becomes broken, Mr. Bean decides to buy a new one but since his Mini has a flat tire, he decides to take a taxi. The taxi driver deliberately drives around the town and stops for gas and lunch in the hopes of getting a higher fare. Bean tries to escape, but other passengers mistake Bean as the driver, and Bean reluctantly drives the taxi.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs to impress Irma who is infatuated with the hunky deliveryman. Bean tries to improve his physique at the gym but has little success. Instead he opts for an inflatable muscle suit. Irma is indeed impressed and Bean’s plan seems to be working – until the suit gets punctured and Bean makes the mistake of re-inflating it with helium. As Bean floats off into the sky will Irma’s admiration be punctured?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is initially charmed when a seemingly cute seagull turns up on his windowsill. Bean feeds the gull and invites the bird inside. But it’s not long before the seagull in the flat turns out to be a cuckoo in the nest taking over Bean’s home – eating all his food controlling the TV and sleeping in his bed. Bean starts to regret taking on a new best friend in place of good old reliable Teddy.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: While checking out a rogue planet, Ella, Slippy and Madhu crash onto its surface. When the heat from underground causes the planets icy crust to burst open, they all tumble down into the darkness and become separated.

programme.title: Botched: Post Op
programme.desc: The first of a short series of after-show specials that takes an in-depth look at highlighted cases from the hit medical show Botched. Host Heather Dubrow, alongside renowned plastic surgery experts Terry Dubrow and Paul Nassif, recaps a selected Botched episode. Viewers can learn more about the patients at the heart of the show, with never before seen footage and newly-revealed secrets. The hosts are joined by the relevant patients and some surprise celebrity guests in this light-hearted and sometimes comedic look back at the life-changing cases that the doctors were tasked with. Get the inside scoop from the doctors themselves as they discuss the decisions they had to make when managing the needs of the patients in their care. programme.desc: Tools and machines have allowed us to overcome our physical limitations, but they are also transforming what it means to be human.

programme.desc: Hunting for the Lost Dutchman is usually a one-man journey, but Wayne Tuttle is partnering with a team of experts to follow a newly-revealed clue that could finally solve the 500-year-old mystery of Americas most famous buried treasure.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: In the wake of increased reports of Bigfoot sightings from across the United States, scientific methods are used to examine whether witnesses are seeing a known animal or the same creature described throughout history.

programme.desc: New York is one of the most man-made spaces on the planet, but everything from the height of its skyscrapers to the position of its harbour is governed by extraordinary forces.

programme.desc: The most shocking missing item of all: the iconic Ground Zero Flag, raised by firefighters on 9/11. A few hours after it was raised, this sacred relic simply disappeared.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The architecture in Washington DC was inspired by the ancient world. But is it possible that the designs and philosophies enshrined in the streets of the US capital were influenced by an otherworldly source?

programme.title: The Search For The Tesla Files
programme.desc: Marc, Jason and Travis follow the trail back to New York where they discover traces of a shadow government bent on keeping Nikola Teslas files secret.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: A top-secret Nazi project - "Die Glocke," was believed to be a time travel device that could soar through the sky and eventually reach the speed of light and beyond. Did Die Glocke actually exist, and could it have been based on alien technology?

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob and Johns investigation continues in Spain, Morocco and Argentina. The teams look into Hitlers possible escape route while uncovering a plan for a Nazi Fourth Reich.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved

programme.desc: A top-secret Nazi project - "Die Glocke," was believed to be a time travel device that could soar through the sky and eventually reach the speed of light and beyond. Did Die Glocke actually exist, and could it have been based on alien technology?

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob and Johns investigation continues in Spain, Morocco and Argentina. The teams look into Hitlers possible escape route while uncovering a plan for a Nazi Fourth Reich.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee rock out with personal memorabilia from legendary AC/DC front man Angus Young. Next up, Hollywood rebel James Deans ID bracelet finds its way into the shop before Rick heads east to score big with a rare relic from WWII.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick plays ball with Kareem Abdul-Jabbar on a bucket load of his most prized personal memorabilia. Then, Rick receives some correspondence from General George Armstrong Custer. Will this be Ricks last stand, or will he prevail and conquer this deal?

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: The team ignites a massive bonfire to investigate the Bubble. But what appears in the smoke is more chilling than anyone expected.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Did a UFO follow two researchers home from an investigation? How did a bear learn to act like a human? Did a trucker capture a legendary Native American creature on his dash cam? Could underwater extraterrestrials be leaving messages on the ocean?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Did aerospace engineer Wernher von Braun have secrets collected by the Nazis in WWII, or access to technology recovered from Roswell? Is it possible that the worlds greatest rocket scientist found his inspiration not on our world, but another?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller strolls in with a collection of action figures signed by the cast of The Walking Dead, will Chum bite? Corey is too cool when a Rock n Roll High School poster comes into the shop. Will the deal be music to his ears?

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.desc: The world is full of stunning displays of natural phenomena that are so spectacular and, at times, so strange they defy conventional wisdom. Can science explain Earths mysteries? Or does human knowledge of the Earth only scratch the surface?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island

programme.desc: Throughout history, many have claimed to be able to see into the future. These mystics, prophets, and clairvoyants received visions of events that changed the course of history. But what did their prophecies reveal?

programme.desc: Rick checks out a Funko Pop! Mystery Box. Then, the gang bike to Oregon to fit Ricks ranch with some new equipment.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team looks at a limited edition autographed Game of Thrones item, an Amazonian blowgun, and an intriguing collectible from an early 1900s Democratic National Convention.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Dr. Jacques Vallee is best known for his revolutionary work in the field of UFOs, and his bold theories challenge our notions of alien life. Will his incredible work lead to answers about what has been happening in our skies for thousands of years?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Humans are just scratching the surface when it comes to what we know about our ancestors. Lost cities, ancient texts, mysterious carvings, and unexplained structures provide clues to a long-forgotten time that goes further back in history.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Scattered across the globe lie mysterious ruins that are buried in sand-swept deserts, perched atop towering mountains, and shrouded in the heart of dense jungles. These age-old structures stand as silent sentinels from the past, their true history seemingly erased by time. Can modern archaeology unravel the enigma of how--and why--these wonders were built?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey take a spin in the classic car Hells Chariot, from the movie Grease. Is the flaming hotrod the one that they want, or will they "drop out" of the deal? Then, Chum takes a whack at a Punch-A-Bag game once played by Jack Dempsey.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy can’t reach a sock in the top drawer! He wonders if he’ll ever be tall enough.“When you need to know, go to Okido!” he says. Messy gets to Okido just in time to catch Felix and Zoe leaving to meet Zim, Zam and Zoom at the funfair! They jump into the Okidoodle, but Felix accidentally lets go of the funfair map, which flies away! Messy stops and luckily, Lofty the giant was there to catch it for them. Lofty is with his niece Mini, and so they invite her to the funfair with them. “Mini’s a bit too big for the Okidoodle” notices Messy, so she follows behind on her scooter.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Huckleberry and Blueberry’s Patti Persimmon-style mystery story is rejected by the online mystery magazine, Strawberry comes up with a new way to raise funds for Huck’s pet shelter—a big dog show! Plum attempts to turn the dog show into an extravagant dance performance. The competition heats up, everyone wanting their pup to perform in an even more spectacular manner, and the dog training sessions go comically awry. Meanwhile Huck and Blueberry co-write a monster mystery, inadvertently starting a rumor that a Berry Patch monster is loose! The rumor, combined with Jadeybug from the post office forgetting to send out the show invitations, results in no one coming to the show. Fortunately, Blueberry had submitted her and Huck’s new mystery story to the online magazine, and the editor is thrilled with their work.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is pleased when he wins a game he is playing with Nana so he visits Dino-World where he makes up lots of games and wins every time.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to do lots of things all at once so instead of choosing one activity he goes to Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A visit to the mangrove swamp is in order when Leo and Hero find a baby estuarine crocodile in the garden. Can the Junior Rangers find the baby crocodile’s nest while avoiding the adult crocodiles that roam the swamp?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Christmas is fast approaching and it is the last chance for children to post their letters to Santa. Percy is collecting the mail, but there is a lot of snow on the rails and it isn’t easy to get through. Harold teasing Percy doesn’t help either, but when Percy runs into a snowdrift it is Harold who volunteers to take the letters for him. Percy is cross at having to be helped, but when Harold doesn’t come back it is Percy who goes to find out what happened and help him in return.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Philip spots Toby and assumes that he is a diesel boxcab just like him. Convinced that they will become best friends, Philip rushes up to introduce himself, but Toby finds him rather overwhelming. Philip is very persistent and manages to get Toby to have a race with him, but Toby doesn’t like it very much. Philip gets upset and thinks Toby doesn’t like him, but with a little help he eventually learns that you can be friends with someone who doesn’t like the same things you like.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: At the request of Emma the forest ranger, Grisu has to tag the sick trees in the forest. The trees must absolutely be cut down before the storm arrives. But all the marks he makes are erased by a mysterious eraser: Fume, who is determined to defend his tree. Grisu finds a solution by using his father to replant the tree sheltered from the wind.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Olivia competes in the famous Sand Dune Race in a new electric 4x4 she has designed, but her co-pilot has just pulled out. Fortunately, Grisu will take his place. Accompanied by Fume and Stella, he joins Olivia in the desert. The race begins and soon Slad and Vlad - better known as “The Tricktwins” - give them a hard time. The twins, ready to do anything to win, try to trick them. While Grisu and Olivias charred windsceen prevents them from moving forward, Grisu has an idea that allows them to get back in the race. Before crossing the finish line, they even help the Tricktwins to get out of a quicksand.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As Woodsy is going to sleep over at Loudo’s, there is a spare place in the burrow. Rosie wants to invite Biva but Scoutbadger wants to invite Martis. Edmund, who does not like it when things get too boisterous, says only one friend can come. Scoutbadger and Rosie quarrel over which one can invite their best friend…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are creating a Soft Play Cafe for Chef Tattie in an old warehouse by the docks, ready for an opening party tomorrow. Though the build is on track, Chef can’t decide what colour to paint the disco room so Bob offers to put up paint samples for him to choose from. Leo shows off his ‘mash-up’ app and Tattie decides that Leo should DJ for the party. However, Leo isn’t as confident as he appeared to Chef and the extra responsibility distracts him from the build. Eventually he ends up walking through spilled paint after putting up the colour samples, leaving differently coloured footprints all over the floor.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo is late as he’s overslept thanks to staying up late playing a fishing game on his phone. Bob, Lofty, Leo and Wendy are installing a satellite dish and at the Spring City News HQ located at the docks. The dish has to be in place in time for the Six O’Clock News bulletin. En route to site the team stop to say hello to the Spring City Rockets who are practicing in preparation for a dance show later that day which will be covered on the news. On site Leo and Lofty are teamed up. During the build Leo is distracted by the game; Lofty suggests he should pay more attention. While tying the dish to Lofty’s hook Leo - distracted by the game - does not secure it properly. As Lofty raises the dish it comes loose and drops to the floor.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. They discover the dolly inside a grand piano thats playing a few sour notes./Cars are disappearing from a particular parking space, Huckle and gang set out to find out why.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Who’s that hopping into the garden? Why, it’s a yellow-footed rock-wallaby—and its baby! The Junior Rangers hightail it to Australia to send mother and child home, but will a couple of flat tires throw a spanner in the works?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A vervet monkey shows up as an uninvited guest to one of Leo’s picnics. The Junior Rangers head to the savannah to bring the monkey home, but the trip takes a nasty turn when they fall into an animal trap.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s winter, the yard is covered in snow. Simon’s friends, Ferdinand and Mamadou suggest they have a sled race. Simon thinks this is an awesome idea! They decide that Simon will team up with his brother Gaspard on one sled and Ferdinand and Mamadou on the other. Simon complains. His brother is too small, he’s sure to lose! The first races are indeed a bit of a fiasco and Simon gets annoyed at his brother and so Gaspard goes home to sulk. That is until Simon realizes that Gaspard can actually help him win…because he’s lighter! And what if we always needed someone smaller than ourselves to win?!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda one morning wakes up especially early, she is visited by Robin. He tells her that he as a robin wakes the sun every morning and invites Tilda to join him the following day. For this, however, Tilda has to get up at half past four! That evening, shes so excited she has difficulty going to bed early.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert has always dreamed of living in the woods. And Tilda thinks wishes like that should be fulfilled. So Tilda, Rupert and Molly set out to spend a night in the forest. Rupert is amused by all the luggage the ladies are taking with them – for him, the woods have everything one could need! He soon discovers that its not that easy...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is expecting Rupert to breakfast, but the hedgehog doesnt turn up. So Tilda goes to Ruperts house, where Edna tells her that Rupert has gone into the village. The mouse finds it odd that Rupert has forgotten their arrangement and sets off after him.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees try for their ‘Keep Chuggington Beautiful’ badges by thinking of ways to make their city more attractive. Koko’s going to wash down platforms using the firecar and Brewster’s going to repaint some fences using the paintcar. Wilson decides to do some litter-picking – but a stowaway monkey makes things a bit difficult for him! In the end, the monkey helps Wilson in his task and Chuggington is left even more beautiful!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai was enjoying his time by the river, playing with a drone and conducting experiments with his unique smelling bombs. After a brief test that resulted in the area being engulfed in a green cloud, Kai noticed a peculiar creature emitting a peppery scent, prompting him to contact the Junior Rangers for assistance. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie engaged in a friendly competition, trying to determine whether their dog, Hero, would show more interest in his toy or a delicious treat. However, when they called Hero to make his choice, he disregarded both options. Suddenly, Leo received a call from Kai, who informed them about the mysterious creature he had encountered. Utilizing Katies computer, they identified it as a Giant Japanese Salamander. Upon learning that the salamander was trapped and potentially in danger, the Junior Rangers hurried to Kais location. Once there, they collaborated to move a rock, enabling the salamander to escape. However, they noticed that one of its feet had become detached. Concerned for the salamanders well-being, they embarked on a mission to find the missing limb. Fortunately, they encountered Ranger Rocky, who happened to be nearby. They explained the situation, leading Ranger Rocky to contact his colleague, Ranger Joey, for additional assistance. Ranger Joey enlightened them about the salamanders ability to regenerate its legs, relieving everyones worries about its condition.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: While lounging against a tree, Kyle engages in a whimsical conversation with his trusty toy kangaroo, Stella. Suddenly, a tiny lizard approaches him, sparking his curiosity. Eager to get a closer look, Kyles approach startles the lizard, causing it to gracefully glide away to another tree. Bursting with excitement, Kyle immediately contacts his fellow Junior Rangers, Leo and Katie. Meanwhile, Leo and Katies kite-flying adventure takes a nosedive when their kite crashes to the ground. Amidst the disappointment, Leo receives a call from Kyle, who excitedly shares his encounter with the mysterious creature. The Junior Rangers identify it as a Flying Draco Lizard and agree to rendezvous at Kyles location. As they arrive, Kyle accidentally tumbles from the branch but lands safely in a bush. Undeterred, they embark on a quest to find the elusive lizard. Along the way, Kyles insistence on spotting a small dragon sparks a playful argument with Katie, who refutes his claim. Suddenly, their eyes lock onto a branch, where the Flying Draco Lizard perches, unaware of a larger threat approaching. Just in the nick of time, Ranger Rocky, equipped with his trusty paraglider, joins forces with the Junior Rangers. They inform him of the perilous situation, prompting Ranger Rocky to contact his knowledgeable friend, Ranger Joey.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is proud to have been put in charge of feeding Nina’s animals while she’s away. But when he accidentally drops some eggs and commits a series of blunders, the animals change their behavior, and even seem to start avoiding him! Are they upset with T’choupi for being so clumsy?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi discovers Nina’s beautiful dried flowers. He’s so impressed that he wants to make his own collection, as a birthday present for his mom! So, he Nina and Benedicte secretly head off to pick some pretty flowers. But they’re going to have to turn it around fast: they only have one day to get the job done!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: After having to stay indoors during a summer shower, Tchoupi and Nina are happy to be able to go back outside and play. Naturally, with rain comes snails. But unfortunately, T’choupi accidentally drops one, denting its shell. There’s no way he’s going to just walk away and leave it to its fate! So Dad advises the kids on how to take care of the gastropod… not an easy feat, when all it wants to do is run away...!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Tomorrow, Charley and his classmates get to go to the pool! But unfortunately for Charley, he will not be able to go because he cannot stop sneezing: atchoo, atchoo, atchoo!! Forget about swimming, he will have to spend the day under the covers at home and it’s going to be a loooooong day… or so he thinks! Maybe a sick day isn’t so boring after all…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma Gouda challenges a timid Sam to tell a story in front of an audience at the next party she hosts. How could he overcome his stage fright. Julia has some ideas to help her friend...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Invited to dinner at Sams house, Julia makes a stain on the tablecloth while Sams mom is away. Time is running : can Sam and Julia wash the stain and fix Julias big mistake before the dinner?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia pretended to Sam she can do real magic. To prove him so, Julia has to find a way to do that. She will have to find different tricks to let her friend believe she really is a magician.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Shane is having too much fun to stop and refuel; that is, until he runs out of coal and is stranded in the hot, red desert.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas misses his best friend Percy while working on the Chinese railway.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family head to a big, exciting Parade.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family go ice skating, and Caillou accepts his limitations when he struggles to stay balanced.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Its cold weather and Monkey has made a banana peel scarf for Parrot but that is not very warming or comfortable. Mole appears and tells them about sheep and her famously warm wool. Monkey feels that it would be the perfect textile to use and so they fly off to the farm. Watching her inspires monkey to invite Sheep to a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When beavers cause a power cut in Pontypandy, Norman suggests keeping Dilyss frozen food cold outside, which turns out to be a very, very bad idea

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy offers to look after Miss Pawdry, claiming that shes great with animals. But the cat escapes and ends up in a basket drifting towards the sea!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin wants to make breakfast for the family all by himself. When his efforts prove fruitless, he finally asks for help from his Mom, leading to a great breakfast for everyone. /When Franklin and Fox switch roles in an upcoming play, taking on jobs they’ve never done before, it takes a while for them to realize that new challenges are more fun when you’re not afraid to ask for help from those ‘in the know’.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy is suffering from not feeling appreciated enough by the forest children. It is always Scoutbadger who does extraordinary things and gets all the recognition. Woodsy is hurt and decides to pull off an exploit - to bring back the scarecrow’s hat and so be finally acclaimed a hero.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Looking at a picture of the desert, Sketcky wonders what one could do in such a huge desert. Doodleboo has an idea of Riddleboo, full of travels and surprises!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky has no idea how to go to space and approach the biggest star. Fortunately, Doodleboo has a Riddleboo that could help him travel in space.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to get engaged with Bubble when he becomes a great prince! Doodleboo has a little idea of Riddleboo that would be the perfect engagement gift that Sketcky could offer to Bubble!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave learn how to keep score when they compete in Hatty’s Game Show. There’s lots of fun to be had in two quick-fire question rounds, a singing competition, a Rollypod race and an egg and spoon race ... but who will win? Ruff-Ruff discovers you don’t always have to be the fastest to win!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave each make a wish, to make their dreams come true. Ruff-Ruff wishes for lots of sticks to chase, Dave for lots of bananas to eat and Tweet wishes she could fly high in the sky. But when their wishes go wrong, they realise you have to be ‘careful what you wish for’, and that it feels good to make wishes for others too, not just for yourself.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Seeing his tracks in the fresh snow inspires Little Nutbrown Hare to create a new game called ‘snow seek’. The friends have a lot of fun creating tracks for Little Nutbrown Hare to follow, but Little Redwood Fox’s tracks completely disappear and so does she. When Big Nutbrown Hare reports that Little Redwood Fox was sighted walking backwards, they work out how she managed to trick them all.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse finds a sparkly rock and announces that it’s treasure. Little Nutbrown Hare wants a sparkly treasure too, so they set about finding him one that night, by the silvery light of the full moon. Together, they discover that treasure is found in the most unexpected places. When a very ordinary looking rock cracks open to reveal sparkly crystals inside, Little Nutbrown Hare realises that things are not always what they seem.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of ‘sparkle magic’ when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing can’t play with her special sparkly things. Amma suggests that Bing makes his own sparkle magic stone but disaster strikes when Bing accidentally spills Sula’s precious sparkle dust.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are in the sandpit pretending to be diggers. Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in. It takes Flop to show them how they can work together to be just like the digger men they saw planting a tree in the park earlier.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Its midday and Busytown citizens are dozing off all over town. Huckle, Sally and Lowly try to find out why. Noticing the number of sleeping people holding melted ice cream cones is an important clue. Ultimately, the kids discover that the ice cream truck isnt playing the usual perky tune to announce its arrival - its playing a lullaby./Someone has taken Huckle’s car and left their car in its place!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey has designed a paper airplane, he boasts how this will be the fastest paper airplane ever. But when he throws it, the plane immediately falls to the ground. When they meet Eagle they are impressed by his keen eye site and fast flying as he spotted Monkeys paper plane on the ground and glides down to get it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass or a map either.

programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper finds an old key and remembers that it is for a clockwork mouse in his toybox. His friend Mouse is unimpressed - its not like a real mouse. Kipper decides the two mice should have a race but, when the clockwork mouse wins, Mouse has had enough and decides to hide the key.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: At the seaside Tiger just wants to read his book. Kipper keeps interrupting him so Tiger tells him to go for a swim. Kipper plays ball with a friendly sea lion but Tiger doesn’t believe him. He finishes his book and Kipper starts reading – now he wants to be left alone. Tiger meets the sea lion too and soon all three of them play happily together, book forgotten

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are excited to be looking after a guest - a friend’s "unique" rooster by the name of Rigoletto. They ask Fred what makes it so unique but he’s not sure; all he knows is that they need to take good care of it. However, despite being housed in its very own enclosure, Rigoletto escapes and goes missing!! Huh! Maybe the animal’s "uniqueness" will allow the kids to track it down…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia and Sam must babysit Ben. A game of hide and seek is launched in the residence. But Sams little brother is so well hidden that he cant be found. Where could he be hiding?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It’s time for spring-cleaning and Tilda decides to give her friends all the things that she doesn’t need any more and brings them in her garden. But her friends now think she’s moving out.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: In Grandpa’s garden, Turbulent is fascinated by the super heroes’ stories he can read in his book. He wishes too to be a Kind Vigilante who saves the lovely and the helpless. Unfortunately, every time he tries to save someone, his sister who stucked her kite in a tree or his brother who is afraid of a spider for example, Grandpa always comes first and fixes the problem. When Turbulent was at the most discouraging point, a new villain appears ant kidnap all the people he loves, the Kind Vigilante is back in business!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are playing in the park when Mommy calls them because it’s time to go home. When they arrive she asks them if Toto is not with them but the Triplets thought he was already with Mommy! What a disaster! Toto is lost! It’s the total panic, the Triplets are desperate and worst, the park is about to close! Everyone starts to look for Toto, Grandpa makes the tour of the neighborhood, Mommy hangs signs everywhere and calls the Police. We absolutely need to find him !

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox has brought some elderberries for the children. Unknown to the others, Edmund swallows one and then learns that the number had been calculated so that each child received the same amount of berries. Edmund slips away to find another elderberry. Meanwhile, the children share out the berries and find that there are three left over. What should they do ? There seems to be no simple solution…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou Leo and Clementine go to a "high ropes" park with Clems brother. Clementine and Caillou learn to be supportive friends and help Leo conquer his fears.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou struggles in a test at school and gets caught cheating. He learns to admit when things are hard so he can be helped.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Bertie, Thomas and Spencer get into a debate about how many wheels is best. Bertie has four wheels, Thomas has six and Spencer is very proud of his twelve. But when Spencer breaks down while taking the Duke and Duchess to Callan Castle, Thomas must transport his passengers instead. Then Thomas finds the track blocked and Bertie takes over. And when Bertie has a flat tyre who should turn up, but the Thin Controller on his bicycle. Surely the Duke and Duchess can’t ride to Callan Castle on his bike! Luckily, the Thin Controller has a better idea about how to help.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Tyne tunnels through the mountain, while the rest of the chuggineers are hard at work finishing a bridge for the new high - speed link to Tootington. Just as Tyne is about to break through, Brewster averts disaster by spotting that a track joint hasn’t been welded. Zack gets it done in the nick of time and Tyne and the tunnel - boring machine drive safely out onto the new bridge. As a gesture of appreciation, Zack names the bridge after Brewster.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Speed Fleet, Chug Patrol and the Chuggineers are competing in the Track Dash fun race. The team that has all its members cross the finish line first wins. Koko is sure Speed Fleet will win, until Hanzo breaks down and can’t move! Brewster and Wilson offer to help, but Koko tells them they may as well finish the race; there’s no way Speed Fleet can win now. They refuse. Koko needs them more than their teams do. They’re Team Trainee! Using the Mega Crane, Brewster and Wilson transport Hanzo across the finish line.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Tomorrow, Charley and his classmates get to go to the pool! But unfortunately for Charley, he will not be able to go because he cannot stop sneezing: atchoo, atchoo, atchoo!! Forget about swimming, he will have to spend the day under the covers at home and it’s going to be a loooooong day… or so he thinks! Maybe a sick day isn’t so boring after all…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave celebrate Hatty’s birthday by playing all of his favourite party games; and find him a surprise birthday gift along the way.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi, Nina and Mom are busy sowing seeds in the small vegetable garden. But a bird keeps coming along and pecking them up as soon as they’ve been sown! So T’choupi and Nina decide to build a scarecrow to protect the seedbeds. They go about it in secret (although with Dad’s help) to give Mom a nice surprise. However, they get a disappointment when they realize their scarecrow isn’t scary at all!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle was lounging on the beach, stargazing with his toy kangaroo Stella as he admiring the peaceful moment. Then he was interrupted by a fallen coconut. Startled by the sound, Kyle grab his flashlight to check out. Turns out a coconut has fallen and it nearby fallen besides him. Unknowing to him, a big coconut crab climbs down behind him. He turns around and was surprise. He then realize its a crab and gets fascinated by it. The crab then immediately goes down and eat the opened coconut. Kyle take the picture and send it to the Rangers. Back at the base, Katie is showing Leo of the new night vision feature she has on her tablet. Katie points her tablet elsewhere and they see 2 white dots running towards them from the garden forest, ultimately reveals it to be Hero. Leo pets Hero before receiving a call from Kyle. Kyle explain on the crab he discovers, currently towering over a coconut at the moment. Katie analyses the picture and learn its a Coconut Crab. After learning of the animal, Leo has a safety concern for the beach-goers and suggest they go there to put signs on the beach. The Ranger equip their gear and ride PlatypusOne to meet up with Kyle. At the beach, the Rangers sees Kyle observing the coconut crab. They have a discussion on how to making the wooden sign.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Stanley and Balthazar ruin Flutters playing cards, but seeing the butterfly girls sadness, they ask Dollys help to make a brand new card deck.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Leapy the grasshopper makes fun of Katie the yellow ladybird, because she blows bigger bubbles than her. Later, regretting her actions, Leapy has to find a way to apologize to Katie.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Dolly accidentally knocks over a glass of water on Berrys painting. The colors on Berrys painting get faint and watery. Berry gets mad at Dolly for ruining his painting. Later Berrys friends admire the little snails unique style of painting, so he insists that it was his idea to make the painting like this. But then Dolly arrives and sheds light to Berrys lies.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon has found an old guitar in the attic. Eva, his mother, offers to give him lessons but Simon would rather go show off to his friends, Ferdinand and Lou, who are playing in the yard. The three friends decide to form a band. But they understand pretty quickly that musically speaking, they stink! Simon goes to find his mother and asks her for some musical advice. And it works. He returns to his friends and now it’s his turn to give them advice. And they’re off and playing! What a talented band!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Home sometimes gets crowded, especially when theres a teddy-bear battle going on. There isnt enough space left for Boribons blue teddy bears. Annalee eventually finds a solution to the problem.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia want to play as if they own a restaurant. But its not so easy to decide on the menu, the name of the place, and to manage their first difficult customers, Ella and Tonio.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: While playing against Tonio, Julia lost Sams beautiful marble. The two mice do everything to recover it, but Julia would like to understand why this marble was so precious to him...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: While buying pastries at Mrs Bun’s bakery, mom puts up a flyer for a babysitter. A baby sitter for the Triplets? « Out of the question! », reply the three kids in unison. After making sure that the first applicants never manage to reach their mom on the phone, Eliott, a teenage boy, gets to try out for the job. But the Triplets have more than one trick up their sleeves and have decided to drive the poor Eliott completely crazy. Mom comes home to a most surprising scene: the poor boy is asleep on the couch and the triplets are quietly playing cards.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Poet was quietly sitting on the pot when he suddenly heard a horrible sound and quickly ran away, convinced that a dragon was hiding in the toilet. The triplets called their Grandpa for help, but he only managed to stop the roaring temporarily. "He must be hungry", suggests Girl, so why not feed him the roast? Another miss, but Toto had a feast! Good thing Mom called a real dragon hunter to the rescue, a "plumber", and everything returns to normal. There is just one slight problem: there is nothing left for dinner!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: It’s the trainees’ day off -­‐ and Koko and Brewster want to do things they never normally do. Wilson is in charge and he’s organised lots of activities for them – feeding the monkeys at the Safari Park and pretending to be Action Chugger on a flight simulator. But when the fun ends sooner than Wilson had planned, he must think of something fast so that he doesn’t disappoint his friends. Just as Wilson runs out of ideas, they come across Chatsworth.
