programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper and Tiger go to the stream and play with their paper boats. They decide playing pirates and building a raft is more exciting. Soon they find themselves marooned on an island in the stream….but luckily Pig is there to save them.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou feels intimidated when Billy, Clementine’s brother, shows off some super cool moves at the skate park. Caillou pretends to be Skip Super, facing off against Giant Rexy while helping new superhero, Kick-Flip (Billy), overcome his feelings of inadequacy to help save the day.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou gets carried away with generosity when at the neighbourhood Give and Take and he gives Rosie’s doll away without asking. In a Pirate fantasy where his treasure is given to a sea monster, Caillou learns that it’s not right to give things away that don’t belong to you.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was talking to her mom on her phone as she walks down a lonely street lined with a lampposts. As she stops under a lamppost and the light begins to flicker, she slowly looks upwards to see a monster hanging from a lamppost. She skates away in fear, and remember her phone was there. She returns to the area and notice the so-called monster looks like a bat. Back in the garden, Leo is practicing with his jetpack maneuvering skill by performing spiral pattern and zig zag. He talks to Katie who is by her computer. After almost crashing into Hero the dog, Leo crash lands on the ground. Katie jokes on his skill before Leo receives a call from Zari. Zari informs them of the monster she met, which they later to learn it is a Greater Flying Fox. After agreeing to help Zari out, the Junior Rangers travels to her location. They meet up with Zari under the lamppost, where she show them of the animal. Hero tries barking at the animal but it ignores him. Katie has an idea and pulled her tablet to guide the flying fox away. Leo takes Katies tablet and fly with his jetpack to guide the Flying fox. As they were travelling, Katie notices Leos Jetpack is malfunctioning, causing Leo to have issues with flying and he crash land uncontrollably into a bush. They check up on him and Leo is okay.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was driving her dirt bike but she stops as she hears a loud cries, grabbing her attention. She investigate and finds a baby moon bear crying for help. Back in the garden, Katie and Leo are playing tag. Leo blocks Katies path to touch Hero but Katie manages to tricks him. But Hero manages to escape as he was distracted by a butterfly. Suddenly, Farah calls for help through Leos watch, informing them of the poor animal cub with her. After the Junior Rangers learn that its a Moon Bear cub and wanting to help, they travel to meet up with Farah by riding PlatypusOne. Once theyre there, Farah tells them she has name the cub Cubby. Katie then reads her tablet and says that moon bear need to learn how to climb trees, swim, mark territories and communicate with other bears to survive, hence a montage happens of the Junior Rangers. Then they try teaching Cubby how to growl like a bear so they all imitate bear growling. Cubby gives it a try but struggle to do it. Ranger Rocky randomly appears and the Junior Rangers tells him of their situation. Ranger Rocky decides to call out his dear friend Ranger Joey and asks for help.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pats special mission is to deliver a family of hibernating fruit bats to Amy.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must find some missing duck eggs before they start to hatch, and get them to Amy.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden, so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and the gang are eagerly making preparations for the following day’s Big City Autumn Festival. There is a lot of excitement and activity in the air and once the preparations have been made everyone retires for the night in eager anticipation of the next day. The following morning, however, they wake up to find it has snowed overnight, making plans for a Big City Autumn Festival seem ruined. But ever the optimist, Oswald shows everyone that they can have an even better time in the snow.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie catch a firefly in Big City Park and get their chance to make a wish. But making a wish is a lot harder than they think – after all, they love everything they already have. After a whole day and night of not being able to make up their minds, Oswald and Weenie return to the Park only to find that all of the other fireflies have disappeared! Only then does Oswald realise what the wish should be.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team have been busy building a new water park, “Spring City Splash” that includes a wave pool and splash zone. Now there is only one thing left to build... the double dragon water slide. Scoop loves dragons and cannot wait to help build the slides, but when he is asked to help build the support beams instead, he is less than impressed with his job. As Bob attaches the new water park entrance sign, Scoop digs foundations for the support beams. Suddenly Scoop becomes distracted with the arrival of the dragon slides and doesn’t finish the foundations. He attempts to see the dragon slides only to be sent back to finish his job. Now totally eager to get to the slides, Scoop rushes to complete his job and doesn’t realise that the support beams are not set and are beginning to lean.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo and Muck are having great fun playing the very latest computer game “Space Robots!” Bob reminds them they’ve got an early start in the morning. Muck pleads to stay up a bit longer and Leo promises they’ll get a good night’s sleep…just as soon as they reach the top level of the game. But at dawn they’re still playing! Next morning, Leo and Muck are very tired and sleepy. Bob explains that they have to finish building The Spring City Wheel, a huge Ferris-wheel, in the Docklands Regeneration Area. He’s promised the Spring City Rockets they’ll be the first to ride on it - today! Bob and the gang drive towards the site but on the way Muck and Leo stop to have a quick nap.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are playing pirates. Where is the treasure in the garden?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But the coupons never arrive. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is in his kitchen and he is really hungry… His tummy thinks it’s lunchtime already! “My tummy’s not very good at telling the time” he says, “but what is time anyway? Hm, when you need to know, go to Okido!” He lands with a jump in Zoe and Felix’s garden just in time to go to the lab to see what Zim and Zam’s amazing discovery is! They jump into the Okidoodle and go to the Cloudship to find Zim, Zam and Zoom with loads of clocks and the amazing discovery, which is… a door. The trio look unimpressed. But it turns out to be a time machine!

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the Okido Circus today and Messy is worried about performing his tripple flip. Will his friends be able to help him conquer his tummy flutters before the audience arrives?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Plum’s plan to direct a small, simple fairytale play as a surprise performance for the Baby Berrykins snowballs out of control when she hears of the same play being done on a grand scale in Berry Big City. Not listening to Strawberry’s advice to keep it simple, she becomes convinced that unless her production is as big, she’ll be the laughing stock of the berry bitty theatrical world! Casting the girls and Berrykins as stage stars in a sendup of “Snow White and the Seven Dwarves,” Plum attempts to match the spectacular stage effects of a big city theater.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A preschool boy named Harry receives a bucket full of toy dinosaurs. This bucket holds a secret --- by using its power, Harry can travel with his dinosaurs to an amazing land of imagination called Dino World.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry thinks his delicious cookie has been stolen he goes to Dino-World where he plays at being a detective searching for the thief.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a baby plantain squirrel eating his seed collection. The Junior Rangers drive to the forest to locate the squirrel’s nest and mother.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Gordon is late to pull the Express the Fat Controller gives it to Henry instead. Because Gordon has said how difficult his work is, Henry doubts he’s up to the job but more than proves himself and all the passengers love him. Gordon is left to take over Henry’s work, which he thinks is beneath him, and he ends up going on strike. The Fat Controller insists Gordon pulls the Flying Kipper as penance but Gordon refuses till Henry makes Gordon think the job is too hard for him, spurring Gordon to prove Henry wrong

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel always likes to appear rough and tough in front of Arry and Bert. But when Thomas, unexpectedly, finds him lovingly fussing over some baby ducklings he threatens to tell everyone that Diesel is just a big softie. Diesel is horrified and promises to be nice to everyone in exchange for Thomas not telling anyone about the ducklings. All the engines are pleasantly surprised when Diesel starts being polite and friendly, but just how long can he keep it up?

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A rare bird, the Picking Bird, is in the forest for a very short time, and Dr. Natureza wants to be the first to take a photo. But she caught a terrible cold, so it will be up to Grisù to help her as a wildlife photographer. Exploring the forest is an exciting adventure for Grisù and Stella, but the mysterious bird isn’t easy to spot. Plus Fume, who’s searching ingredients for a dragon recipe, unintentionally messes up with Grisù’s mission. In the end, however, Grisù understands that the bird is attracted by sparkling stuff. So he comes up with an inventive way to take the perfect picture just before sunset.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to babysit and feed a little sea lion while Dr. Natureza is healing its mother. They must prevent the cub from reaching the sea and get lost, but the baby is pretty lively and the mission is not so easy. When the sea lion goes missing, a quest begins. Eventually, the little dragon realizes that the sea lions are very sociable animals, and they love to play, so he will create an improvised fun fair to get the cub back, avoiding other getaways.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The badger-foxes have to quickly organize the forest dance. This mainly consists of starting off the dancing. Edmund does not know how to dance and tries to find ways of getting around this problem. The children will do everything they can to help him so that Margaret, who loves dancing, will not be disappointed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a solar panel demonstration, Mayor Madison decrees that the Sea Life Center will be entirely powered by renewable energy. Bob and the team must build a wind farm, which excites Scoop - he cant wait to see the spinny things going round. As they begin construction, Mr Bentley arrives and pulls Bob away, enthusing about other renewable energy schemes they have planned. Spring City will need more energy as it grows, so they need to think ahead. Scoop decides he should think ahead like Mr Bentley suggests, and convinces Lofty to move some of the turbines closer together.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob announces there’s been a Spring City Clock Competition to design the new Spring City Clock – and guess who’s won? The Spring City Rockets! Bob shows the Machines their winning design and explains that metal figures will emerge and sound the bells on the clock. Wendy has been welding the metal figures together. Leo arrives and is looking forward to helping Bob with the decorative cladding around the clock tower but Bob tells him it’s Recycling Day today and his job is to take all the recycling to the Centre first. Bob and the Machines set off to the site while Leo and Muck gather up the boxes of recycling from around the Yard. But Leo is in such a hurry that he mistakes the box with the metal figures in for recycling and dumps it at the Recycling Centre.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-crested cockatoo joins Leo and Hero’s game of musical statues. After learning more about the bird, the Junior Rangers travel to the rainforest to take it home.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie finds out that a big fish in the garden pond is a whitespotted bamboo shark. The Junior Rangers sail to the Pacific Ocean to find a coral reef for the bamboo shark to live in.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s Gaspard’s birthday. Simon has found out where Mommy has hidden his brother’s present. But Simon has sworn he’ll keep it a secret! Still, he can’t stop himself from arousing Gaspard’s curiosity. His little brother finally understands that the present is hidden somewhere in the house. He starts looking everywhere! Simon is getting worried. So that Gaspard won’t find it, Simon changes hiding places at the last split second. But the big surprise is for Mommy when she finds the present has disappeared! Ah, but Simon knows where it is and even more important, he’s been able to keep it a secret!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing accidentally leaves his Hoppity Voosh toy at the park, Amma helps Bing focus and retrace his steps to find it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda wants to open a hotel so that people from far afield can spend time in beautiful Wild Rose Lane. Rupert thinks its a bad idea, but Tilda sticks to her guns. Then the first guests arrive at Hotel Appleseed, a frog and his son. But instead of being quiet and polite, the guests turn Tildas house on its head. Soon she is rushed off her feet with work.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, a mouse called Ferdinand Pearstalk turns up on Tildas doorstep and announces that he will be taking over her house: the vicar has swapped churches and with him the church mouse. To Tildas amazement, he immediately moves in. With a heavy heart, Tilda puts all her stuff on a handcart and trundles off.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert teaches the kids how to find one’s way through the forest. But as they search their way home, Rupert falls asleep. The kids follow their tracks and also help Rupert find his way back.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: This badge is a little different. The trainees must award this badge to someone they appreciate. Brewster finds it difficult, as he appreciates so many of his friends for so many different reasons. In the end, he decides to award it Vee, who always keeps an eye out for him, encourages him to do his best - and keeps Chuggington running like clockwork!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Junior Ranger Zari is on a forest patrol in the Malaysian Forest when she later discovers an adorable Asian baby elephant. She contacts her fellow Junior Rangers Leo and Katie to ask for some help. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie were filling up an inflatable pool with water. They were interrupted when Leo receives a call from Zari, asking help on the baby elephant. After learning more about Asian elephants through Katies tablet and realize that the baby elephant must have been separated from its herd, they set off on a mission to reunite the baby elephant with its mother. When the Junior Ranger arrives, they see that baby elephant was cheerful beside Zari. Katie pulls up her tablet to see the closest river when they can go to meet the mother. After a while, the baby elephant sees a mud puddle and happily runs and lies in it. Then Ranger Rocky appears as he was nearby, introducing himself. The baby elephant sees Ranger Rocky and playfully cuddle from the baby elephant as it approaches him. Unable to free Ranger Rocky from the elephants weight, they come up with a clever plan using a branch as a snack to lure the baby elephant away.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the dense Borneo forest, Farah faces a daunting challenge as she attempts to conquer a fallen tree trunk. With determination and strength, she overcomes the obstacle, celebrating a fleeting triumph. However, her moment of victory quickly transforms into an unexpected stumble when a mischievous tree root thwarts her progress, sending her crashing to the ground. As Farah lifts her head, her gaze is met with a sight that stirs her empathy—a distressed animal in need of assistance. Filled with concern, she extends her hand to aid the creature, only to be met with a sharp snap, forcing her to retreat. Meanwhile, in a different setting, Leo and Katie cautiously approach their canine companion, Hero, who is blissfully engrossed in chewing his bone. Intriguingly, they inform Hero of a promised reward, but with a peculiar condition—he must don a blindfold. Intrigued and trusting, Hero agrees, and Leo skillfully secures the blindfold around his loyal friend, while Katie lifts him up. Together, they embark on an adventure that leads them to a bathtub filled with frothy bubbles, aiming to fulfill the enigmatic reward. However, a slight misstep by Leo, unintentionally triggering a rubber duckie, shatters their stealthy approach, alerting Hero to the unusual situation. In an instant, Hero darts away, prompting the Junior Rangers to pursue him relentlessly. Amidst the commotion, Leos phone rings, and he answers to find Farah on the line, urgently requesting their help with a distressed turtle.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are playing in the cottage when a big "boom" startles them. Running out onto the terrace, they find a stunned sparrow: it’s obvious the small bird flew into the window and has gotten a big bump from the collision! Dad insists the animal needs peace and quiet in order to recover. T’choupi and Nina set themselves the mission of tending to the wounded bird. But disruptions in the cottage, such as a fleeing goat and a chasing cat, make their task way more difficult than expected! Will T’choupi and Nina manage to help the sparrow fly again?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi spots a baby rabbit at the edge of the garden. Taking pity on this lone animal, he decides he wants to keep it. So he introduces it to Plume and Plumeau, hoping they’ll all play together. But despite his good intentions, T’choupi realizes before long that you can’t just invite any random guest into your home…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a "special kind of hide And seek," using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic "kookoo" greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley cannot wait to see the circus with his friends! Except that he has misunderstood, it’s actually the circus that is coming to his school! There are workshops with clowns, on juggling and acrobatics… Everyone is having a wonderful time except for Jane who has trouble finding a workshop that suits her…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia found a gift in her mothers closet and she thinks it is hers. With Sams help, our impatient Julia tries to figure out what is in the package but destroy a part of it. How to it back as it was?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Around the World: Sam dreams of travelling the world, so he and Julia turn the Mouse Mansion into a global adventure. (S1, ep 14)

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily loves listening to stories of Nias travels - she has been all the way around the world and had some big adventures. It feels like ages since Emily left Sodor to go to the Great Railway Show - and everyones heard that story already. Rebecca can see that Emily is longing for a bit of adventure and so, when Nia is asked to take the Sodor Rangers up to Callan Castle, Rebecca suggests that Emily do the job instead. Emily ends up derailed and lost in the fog. But when Nia comes to the rescue she finds an exciting girls-together campsite! Emily and Nia camp out all night with the Sodor Rangers! The two friends return in the morning with an exciting story to tell!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Daddy play a VR video game in an arcade, as Caillou tries to win a Robot toy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends all try and stay awake until midnight on New Year’s Eve.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to prove to Pig Will and Pig Won’t that the figure they saw wearing a strange yellow suit and helmet is not a spaceman from another planet. The clues finally lead them to the realization that it was really Granny Goodpig wearing her yellow suit to protect her while she collected honey from her beehives./ Someone took all the red roses from Granny Goats garden leaving Huckle and gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkeys enormous pile of coconuts falls into parrot’s hammock and rips it. Monkey looks for a needle to fix it. Mole suggests going to Hedgehog, whose back is covered with prickly needle like spines. They fly off to the forest and meet the shy hedgehog who gives them a needle and plays a game of Monkey See Monkey Do with them.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy and Sarah are making a film comparing what dogs and cats are good at, and the cats are clearly doing better than dogs, even at fetch! But soon a kitchen fire gives Nipper the dog a chance to save the day.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At a picnic on Annies farm, Peter comes up with a series of games that almost lead to disaster! Meanwhile, Lizzie and Jodie search for a rare seal.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin struggles with making the “perfect” sculpture for Aunt T’s found-object sculpture garden -- until he learns to “see” his, and everyone else’s, sculpture in a different light. /When Franklin and Bear - not cooperating well - lose a badminton doubles challenge and are forced to walk around three-legged style for an entire day, they have no choice but to finally learn how to really work together as a team.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox has brought some elderberries for the children. Unknown to the others, Edmund swallows one and then learns that the number had been calculated so that each child received the same amount of berries. Edmund slips away to find another elderberry. Meanwhile, the children share out the berries and find that there are three left over. What should they do ? There seems to be no simple solution…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky invented a song for the islands great singing competition that evening! But he needs a musician to accompany him and has not found anyone... Doodleboo will help him, thanks to a Riddleboo! And he is sure that what his friend needs is a very good castanets player!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to organize a football tournament but he does not know how to do it... Doodleboo surely has an idea of Riddleboo to help him.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is looking for the perfect gift for Mothers Day! He can count on Doodleboo to have a good idea...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave listen out for some very strange noises in Hatty’s garden. Who or what is making the ‘Bang-Bang, Ting-ting-a-ling and Ratta-tat-tat’ sounds and will Dave’s ‘Blue Panda Idea,’ stop them from keeping Hatty awake at night?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Mr and Mrs Rabbit and the three Little Bunnies move to a new burrow. But Littlest Bunny doesn’t want to go; and keeping track of all the bunnies’ belongings turns out to be hard work. Tweet has to reassure Littlest Bunny that his favourite cuddly carrot toy will be delivered safely and that he will love his new home.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Winter snow is softening in the meadow and Big Nutbrown Hare finds some beautiful flowers peeking through the snow, a sure sign that Spring is finally on its way. Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants to show Big Nutbrown Hare something special too, something he has never seen before. With the help of his friends Little Nutbrown Hares comes up with a very special and unique treat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey cant seem to slow down. Mole then appears and tells them about the snail who is known for being very slow. Parrot immediately suggests they go to the Meadow. They come across a snail shell which Monkey at first mistakes for a pebble and want to throw into the water, luckily the snail stops him. Soon they are all playing a slow-mo version of Monkey See Monkey Do.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: During a search and rescue drill on Annie’s Farm, Penny and Annie’s childhood rivalry leads to a heated game of hide and seek, a runaway horse, and a river rescue on board Hydrus and Phoenix.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy leads a whirlwind tour of the Seven Wonders of Pontypandy, but her haste to make it to all seven leads to a fire at her campsite!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Pig decide to have a race. The prize is one of Pig’s chocolate cakes. Tiger goes on his tricycle and ends up in the duck pond but Kipper keeps running. Arnold gets a lift with Jake on his scooter. Guess who gets the chocolate cake?

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig leaves Arnold with Kipper and wobbles off on his bicycle. Kipper lends Arnold his first bike and, with the help of stabilisers, they have a wonderful ride round Big Hill. Pig can’t believe its Arnold hurtling towards him on his return – a better bike rider than Pig will ever be.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today is "picnic in the forest day!" And T’choupi and his friends are going to be riding there on their bicycles. Yay, how exciting!... Except, for some reason, Nina doesn’t seem too enthusiastic about it… That’s strange – what could possibly be the matter?: she loves going to the forest and is always up for adventure! She agrees to go in the end, albeit reluctantly. But before long, T’choupi discovers her "shameful secret…"

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When he finds out that today is Nina’s birthday, T’choupi is eager to give her a surprise! And what could be better than have Dad bake one of his yummy cakes?! But to pull it off, they’re going to have to collect eggs and pick strawberries in the hamlet without Nina noticing. And given how eager she is to play with T’choupi, this is no easy feat! When she notices T’choupi is acting mysterious and distant all of a sudden, she even gets a bit annoyed, not to say offended…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Friends Day: Sam overhears Julia talking to her best friend. He thought it was him?! Worried, Sam decides to investigate. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam is convinced that Julia admires her older brother Dan more than him. He tries to change his behavior and personality to get a better image. But does Julia really want him to change?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly’s wool that she just bought disappeared! She’s sure that it must have been stolen, so Tilda and Rupert found the Appleseed Detective Agency. Are the friends going to catch the burglar?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mommy has a great news for the Triplet’s, Mrs Bun, Nini’s mom, is going to have a baby ! The Triplets are super excited but Mommy warns them, Nini may not be so happy about it because it’s not always easy to accept a new baby at home. And indeed, when Eliott and The Triplets arrive at the bakery, Nini is very sad, she doesn’t want this new baby. Mrs Bun, who needs to go to the doctor, gives the key of the shop to Eliott and the children and they are going to do everything that’s possible to make Nini smiles and they’re gonna prove her to have siblings is really really fun !

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: We’re at home with the Triplets and it’s practically time to go to bed, our three children are quietly watching TV, a documentary about firemen which passionates Turbulent. But Girl and Poet are not really happy about it, they’d rather watch a fairytail or a documentary about animals. Next, we have a quarrel for the remote control. After all, the zapper is a magical wand which does whatever you want. But these squabbles drives Mommy crazy and she takes the remote away! When you don’t have a zapper anymore, you just have to make your own TV: the Triplet’s TV!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As Woodsy is going to sleep over at Loudo’s, there is a spare place in the burrow. Rosie wants to invite Biva but Scoutbadger wants to invite Martis. Edmund, who does not like it when things get too boisterous, says only one friend can come. Scoutbadger and Rosie quarrel over which one can invite their best friend…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends learn about Vikings at school, and then have a Viking imagination adventure at break time.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wakes up with an itchy rash. Hes supposed to go and see grandma today, but doesnt want to make her sick, so needs to figure out where it came from.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: On match days Thomas is a very popular engine, because the Sodor football team wear blue. One match day a mainland team come to the island wearing red, and they cheer James because he is red too. Soon the two engines are competing with each other over who can bring the fans to the match faster. But by refusing to pick up supporters wearing the wrong colours, James ends up leaving the rival football team at the station since they are not yet wearing their kit and Thomas rushes right past the Fat Controller who is supposed to be the match referee. In all the confusion and delay there might not be a match at all!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko wishes she were faster - she’s nowhere near as fast as Hanzo. She’s not even as fast as Payce, the new Tootington Tunnel Runner. Koko would love to be a tunnel runner someday. She’s determined to get her speed up and she tries again and again while Hanzo shows Payce around Chuggington. But it’s no good - she can’t do a lap any faster than 9 clickety - clacks. Koko is so disappointed. But when Payce sees the time, she is amazed.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster and Cormac transport a wide, circular tunnel entrance that the chuggineers need in order to finish the high - speed link to Tootington. It spans two tracks and is an awkward load - and when they misjudge a bend, it rolls off. Brewster is devastated; the chuggineers won’t be able to finish the tunnel now! But he doesn’t give up.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley cannot wait to see the circus with his friends! Except that he has misunderstood, it’s actually the circus that is coming to his school! There are workshops with clowns, on juggling and acrobatics… Everyone is having a wonderful time except for Jane who has trouble finding a workshop that suits her…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave build a playhouse for some rabbits. They have fun with shaped building blocks and discover that by working as a team they can achieve great things.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out playing in the forest, T’choupi and Nina come across a broken bird’s egg. Wooow! Look at that: a little chick has literally just been born! But wait a minute: this particular egg is blue, and as far as they know, birds don’t lay blue eggs… Could it be from another type of animal?? And if so, which one? Super excited, T’choupi and Nina start searching for the mysterious creature that laid this blue egg…

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah preparing her morning and setting up her portable radio, she later stumbles upon a little kitten with black-lined ears mewing and walking around aimlessly. Looking for its mother, Farah realizes the kitten is lost and calls for help. Back in the garden, Leo is finishing up a birdhouse before Katie joins him. Katie suggests and puts in some seeds. Instead of a bird, Hero runs in chasing a baby squirrel and the squirrel gets into the birdhouse while Hero barks excitedly. Leo receives a call from Farah who tells Leo and Katie about a lost kitten. The rangers head up to the treehouse to learn more about it before agreeing to help her find the kittens mother. Leo, Katie And Hero arrives and find Farah in the forest with the kitten, still mewing restlessly. The rangers conclude the kitten may be looking for its mum, the rangers embark on a journey to help find the mum. They want to leave the clearings to find the kitten’s mum, but the kitten finds the children threatening so it hides away inside a bush nearby. The ranger manage to climb the kitten by giving it a squeaking toy to calm it down.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The doctor has come to give Simon and his little brother their yearly vaccination. Seeing that the boys are scared, the doctor suggests that Simon be his assistant! Simon takes his new role very, very seriously, even though the doctor himself does some pretty silly stuff. The two of them work so well together that Gaspard relaxes completely and the doctor is able to give him his vaccination shot without the little rabbit even noticing. Same for Simon who braves it out like a champ. Ha, doesn’t even hurt!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon goes strawberry hunting. Instead of strawberries, he finds a series of objects: a pair of red shoes, a blue shirt, and a yellow hat. With their help, he finds Annalee, who knows where to find lots and lots of strawberries.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a toothache. His daddy goes to get Dr. Bobola, but Dan, his older brother, thinks the doctor is going to pull his tooth! To avoid this, Julia tries to takes care of Sam instead of the doctor.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Poet is convinced that the frog they found in the garden is actually a princess, but Girl disagrees: it must be a prince! The three kids come up with plans to find out: how about observing how the animal reacts to jewelry or to Toto dressed up as a dragon? But the frog does not blink and there seems to be only one last solution. Turbulent volunteers to give it a kiss! However, nothing happens and the little frog just hops away while Poet and Girl cannot stop laughing: "you kissed a frog!”

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom tells Poet that he should put his cuddly bear in the washing machine, but he does not want to. Mom tries to discreetly steal the bear, but it is easier said than done. Seeing that she is having a hard time, Turbulent and Girl decide to give her a hand to retrieve the cuddly toy, however their commando mission proves to be more complicated than they planned, and the little bear ends up even dirtier than before. Poet can only resign, but what a joy it is to hug a fresh and clean teddy bear.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: It’s a cold day, and Chug Patrol need more salt from the mines to keep Chuggington tracks safe in the icy weather. They escort the chuggineers up the mountain to the quarry, where the salt is mined. When they get there, Speedy is loading bags of salt onto a wagon using a pulley system. Jackman leaves Wilson in charge of things while he escorts Brewster back with the first load of salt. But when Jackman is detained by an accident, Wilson is the only Chug Patroller on the mountain -­‐ and when Fletch is trapped under a snowdrift, he has to think on his wheels.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: During a search and rescue drill on Annie’s Farm, Penny and Annie’s childhood rivalry leads to a heated game of hide and seek, a runaway horse, and a river rescue on board Hydrus and Phoenix.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy leads a whirlwind tour of the Seven Wonders of Pontypandy, but her haste to make it to all seven leads to a fire at her campsite!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper visits Tiger who is in bed with a really bad cold. Tiger is a demanding patient and none of the things Kipper has brought to cheer him up seem to work. In the end Kipper calls Pig and Arnold in to give the patient some of his medicine.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig asks Kipper to look after Arnold and says he’s really tired so he won’t be any trouble. Kipper reads to him, makes a house under the table, turns a cardboard box into a railway engine, but by the time Pig returns, it’s Kipper who can’t keep his eyes open.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou is sad when the sandcastle he built with Grandpa gets washed away. In a medieval fantasy, the Silver Knight (Caillou) helps the King (Daddy) rebuild his ruined castle, and Caillou learns that it’s the process of creating the castle that is the most fun.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou accidentally breaks Clementines mom’s dinosaur model, he guiltily hides it, but that makes his tummy hurt. In a castaway fantasy, helping Rexy cure his own guilty tummy ache helps Caillou realize the importance of owning up to a mistake.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai testing his new Kaizer upgrade, which detects sounds from afar. He picks up the sound of gushing water and a snow leopards yowl, leading him to investigate further. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a rescue mission game, communicate through their communication devices and pretend to find clues related to a lost hiker. They discover tracks and eventually locate the lost hiker, who is represented by a stuffed toy. They realize they need transportation to rescue the hiker and use Hero, the dog, as their "rescue transportation." The game was cut short as Leo receives a call from Kai on the animal he discover, which was revealed to be a snow leopard and is in trouble. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and meet up with Kai at his location. The Junior Rangers arrive in the mountains of Nepal. Kai struggles to pinpoint the exact location of the Snow Leopard due to the echo caused by the mountains. Hero uses his sense of smell and finds faint Snow Leopard paw prints, leading the group in the right direction. While following the paw prints, they encounter difficulties due to fresh snow covering the tracks. Leo uses binoculars to search for the well-camouflaged Snow Leopard.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is collecting plant specimens at the nature reserves when suddenly she sees an interesting fallen plant nearby and examines it. Then, she sees a pregnant walking catfish squirming about on the path. Weirded out by a fish on land, she calls in the Junior Rangers for some assistance. At the garden, Leo And Katie are playing animal charades. Katie manages to guess Leos chimpanzee performance but Leo cant figure out her Moths performance. Their game is interrupted by Zari, asking their thoughts on the struggling fish. The Junior Rangers get to the treehouse and learn more about the animal in the picture, revealing it as a Walking Catfish. Katie warns Zari not touch it as the fish may sting her with the spike on its spine. Another catfish appears and moves fast, causing Zari to worried if the catfish could be injured. She asks the Junior Ranger to help and the Ranger agree before hoping into PlatypusOne. As they arrive to the scene, the Junior Ranger ask Zari. on the fishs status and Zari replied not that great. They then decide to help the animal get to the nearest body of water and think on how to get the fish into the bucket without getting close to it. While Zari go fill up the bucket with water, Leo grabs the fish with his Backpack Grabber. Zari returns with bucket of water but Leo is having difficulties of grabbing the slippery fish. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky emerge from a bush, surprising the Junior Rangers. He tells them that he was revealing to study tadpoles nearby before meeting them.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Lizzy and Lauren arrange a horse riding lesson for Ben, and Pat brings Pumpkin the pony.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Michael is organising an open-air movie night, but the film is accidentally lost.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Coco and Charlie come to play at Bings house they measure how tall he is, but when they get the measuring ritual wrong, Bing is scared hes growing down!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie play a game of hide and seek that unexpectedly turns into a game of lost and found when Weenie disappears. Worried, Oswald looks all over Big City in search of his pet and finally finds him – fast asleep under Johnny’s car seat. After making sure that Weenie knows never to hide in vehicles again they all celebrate with free ice cream!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and weenie have overslept only to find that everyone else in Big City has also overslept (well, not everyone – Daisy always gets up with the sun!) After waking Henry up, the gang walk through the deserted streets of Big City and reach Alarm Clock Building where they discover that the clock has mysteriously stopped. With the help of his friends, Oswald climbs inside the clock tower to discover the root of the problem – a sleeping squirrel!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are setting up the Spring City Halloween Festival. Everyone is excited except Lofty. Lofty thinks Halloween is scary, so when he is sent to collect a giant ghost decoration he is more than nervous. Meanwhile Wendy is trying to play a Halloween trick on Bob but keeps ending up with the joke on her. Lofty arrives to collect the ghost decoration from Curtis but even the crate it is stored in looks scary. Determined to be brave, Lofty picks up the crate. But then he hears a rattling sound and thinks it’s the ghost. He zooms off, still carrying the crated ghost, hoping to get his scary job over with. By rushing off, he doesn’t realise that the crate is not locked.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are building a special area to celebrate local citizens who have improved the life of Spring City. Each recipient will get to see his or her image inside a golden star on a plinth. But Mayor Madison is struggling to decide who exactly will feature in the very first golden star. Various suggestions include Mr. Bentley, who is very keen to be chosen, Tilly and Jenny. But when the Spring City Rockets suggest Betsy, Scoop decides that the honour should go to a machine – and that machine should be him. Scoop shows off in front of Maria hoping he will be chosen. But his reckless behavior results in cutting through an electric cable and causing a massive power cut.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are going camping and Timmy wants to build his own tent. What does he need for his camping trip?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids search for the owner of a sketchbook that contains drawings done from a high point of view. After determining the artist wasnt drawing at the top of a ladder or up in a tree, they discover the sketchbook belongs to one of Busytowns tallest residents, Jeremy Giraffe. / Huckle and gang investigate a strange temperature drop which turns Busytowns summer to winter.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messys hiccups cause a landslide while out on a nature walk, will he be able to find his way home? And will he ever stop hiccuping?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy has to deliver the giant pongberry to the Pongberry Pie Festival, before it goes off and releases a terrible pong in Okido City!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Asked by the girls to play Prince Berry Charming in the new play that Plum is directing for the Baby Berrykins, Huck pushes aside his reluctance and says yes. Bad goes to comically worse as the girls discover he can’t act, can’t dance, can’t sing, suffers from extreme stage fright, and never really wanted to do the play in the first place. After dress rehearsal devolves into a comedy of errors, Strawberry finally gets the sheepish Huck to confess that acting, singing and dancing are just not for him.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry finds a nest with an egg in it he wants to keep it, but Nana explains that it wouldnt be fair.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to stay up all night so he goes to Dino-World where he can play for as long as he wants.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A common tree frog hops into the garden one wet and rainy day. Leo, Katie and Hero take the frog to the forest, where Ranger Rocky directs them to find the frog’s breeding ground.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The Troublesome Trucks are being particularly cheeky and disobedient. When a new brake van called Bradford arrives from The Mainland Thomas is delighted to work with him as Bradford is excellent at keeping The Troublesome Trucks under control. But Bradford is a real stickler for the rules, and Thomas soon tires of his petty regulations, which are always making him late.. Eventually Thomas is so fed up with Bradford that he decides to go off without a brake van, a reckless and dangerous move, which ends up with Thomas hurtling out of control down Gordon’s Hill with no brake van to stop him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Samson boasts proudly that he has been given a very special job taking stone from the quarry to the docks. But when he learns that Thomas has been given the same job he tries to find another way to prove how important he is. So he decides to take much more trucks than he should insisting that this will save time. But with so many heavy trucks Samson can’t get over Gordon’s Hill. So it takes even longer and when he asks Thomas to help him, he ends up making Thomas late too. The Fat Controller is not happy, but Samson insists that he’s learned his lesson and won’t make the same mistake again…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to pilot a special drone that Mr Guellec bought for his farm, where a Rainbow Magpie is ruining his fruits. The drone’s loudspeaker is supposed to emit a sound that will repel the bird in a harmless way, but things don’t go as planned. Not only does the Rainbow Magpie look unaffected by the drone, but it even mistakes it for a bird and chases after it. Grisu has a hard time shooing the bird away - with Fumè’s intervention making things worse - until he finds out that luring it to the nearby forest is much more effective…

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Toramento, who is setting up a sightseeing tour of the Pink Cave of the Valley. But some funny facts happen in the Cave: signs moving apparently by themselves, strange noises… Toramento suspects that a ghost lives there, but Grisu doesn’t believe it. After a little mayhem, the little dragon finds out that the funny facts are caused by a small but sassy bat, who lives in the Cave and is annoyed by artificial light. Eventually, Grisu, helped by Stella and Toramento, creates a light system built with luminescent rocks, that spreads a soft glow that doesn’t annoy the bat.

programme.title: Pierre Boulez, Academie du Festival de Lucerne
programme.desc: For over six decades, Pierre Boulez had a greater influence on the development of contemporary music than anyone else. Already in his younger days, he gained a reputation as a doughty champion of the avant-garde. With his compositions, interpretations and ideas, he indelibly shaped the international music scene – not only as a composer and conductor, but also as a music philosopher and teacher.

programme.title: Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau : Dernières paroles
programme.desc: The great German baritone Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau was greatly admired for his interpretive insight, note-perfect control of the tonal qualities, and shadings of color in his voice, for exceptional rhythmic sense and impeccable diction. His reputation as a lieder singer is so high – he had a repertoire of more than 3.000 songs – that it is easy to forget his extensive list of operatic roles. In this conversation Fischer-Dieskau reveals for the last time on camera the secrets of his outstanding career. His ‘Last Words’ provide a deep insight into the extraordinary artistic life of one of the most famous and prolific lieder singers of our time. Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau died in May 2012 at the age of 86.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control

programme.title: Wagner´s Jews
programme.desc: Richard Wagner was notoriously anti-Semitic, and his writings on Jews were later embraced by Hitler and the Nazis. But for years, many of Wagner‘s closest associates were Jews - young musicians who became personally devoted to him, and provided crucial help to his work and career. Why were they drawn to him? And how could Wagner even accept their embrace? These questions are at the heart of ‘Wagner‘s Jews’, the first film to focus on Wagner‘s complex personal relationships with Jews. Filmed on location in Germany, Switzerland, and Italy, ‘Wagner‘s Jews’ reveals this remarkable story through archival sources, re-enactments, interviews, and performances of original musical works by Wagner‘s Jewish colleagues. Featuring Zubin Mehta and Leon Botstein among others, the film also explores the ongoing controversy over performing Wagner‘s music in Israel. The same questions asked in Wagner‘s time still resonate today: is it possible to separate the art from its creator? Can sublime music transcend prejudice and bigotry, and the weight of history?Subtitles available for this program with your remote controlSubtítulos disponibles para este programa con su control remoto

programme.title: Yehudi Menuhin, le violon du siècle
programme.desc: Lord Yehudi Menuhin, relaxing at his home in the Greek isles, tells the story of his wonderful career on the eve of his 80th birthday. A wealth of rare archival material illustrates this highly informative and entertaining profile of the worlds greatest violinist, providing insight into the life of the young San Franciscan wonderchild, his sudden rise to stardom which led to an outstanding international career, his encounters with the worlds greatest musicians and music traditions, and his involvement in world politics.Subtitles available for this program with your remote control
